publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-236 Mr Jack McConnell: Abolition of Feudal Tenure (Scotland) Bill Financial Resolution—That the Parliament, for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill, agrees to the following expenditure out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund— (a) expenditure of the Scottish Administration in consequence of the Act; and (b) increases attributable to the Act in the sums payable out of the Fund under any other enactment.

S1M-236 Mr Jack McConnell: Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill Financial Resolution—That the Parliament for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill, agrees to the following expenditure out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund— (a) expenditure of the Scottish Administration in consequence of the Act; and (b) increases attributable to the Act in the sums payable out of the Fund under any other enactment.

S1M-236 Mr Jack McConnell: Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill Financial Resolution—That the Parliament for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill, agrees to the following expenditure out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund— (a) expenditure of the Scottish Administration in consequence of the Act; and (b) increases attributable to the Act in the sums payable out of the Fund under any other enactment.
S1M-236 Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill Financial Resolution (lodged on 28 October 1999) Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-236 Mr Jack McConnell: Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill Financial Resolution-That the Parliament for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Bill, agrees to the following expenditure out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund- (a) expenditure of the Scottish Administration in consequence of the Act; and (b) increases attributable to the Act in the sums payable out of the Fund under any other enactment. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram
